TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Time extends Java.Util.Date

Docs.summary: Java representation of an SQL TIME value.

remarks.para: Java representation of an SQL TIME value. Provides utilities to format and parse the time's representation as a String in JDBC escape format.

MemberSignature.Value: public Time (int theHour, int theMinute, int theSecond);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 theHour, int32 theMinute, int32 theSecond) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a Time object using the supplied values for Hour, Minute and Second.

remarks.para: Constructs a Time object using the supplied values for Hour, Minute and Second. The Year, Month and Day elements of the Time object are set to the date of the Epoch (January 1, 1970).
Any attempt to access the Year, Month or Day elements of a Time object will result in an IllegalArgumentException.
The result is undefined if any argument is out of bounds.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Sql.Time ValueOf(string timeString) cil managed

Docs.param: A String representing the time value in JDBC escape format: hh:mm:ss.
Docs.summary: Creates a Time object from a string holding a time represented in JDBC escape format: hh:mm:ss.

remarks.para: Creates a Time object from a string holding a time represented in JDBC escape format: hh:mm:ss.
An exception occurs if the input string does not comply with this format.

Docs.exception: if the supplied time string is not in JDBC escape format.
